author: jianyunt
body:
The cursor randomly jumps around if you resize your console.  This does not happen on bash. 
For the cloudshell, we want to make pwsh better or @ least on par with bash experience . Please consider for the fix. Thanks. 

Steps to reproduce
------------------
1. Linux VM or CloudShell bash + pwsh
2. ls -la 
3. If you make the console smaller, you will see a large space added before the current line
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10171679/39273591-213eb4a2-4894-11e8-8db6-63c1ddcd4037.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10171679/39273889-1042011c-4895-11e8-822e-0031b6a56e9c.png)

4. make the console bigger, you will see your cursor jump in the middle of the console.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10171679/39273626-3b367c82-4894-11e8-887e-d52b97cf7ddd.png)



```powershell

```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none

```

---------------

```none

```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Does this happen if you `remove-module psreadline`?  If not, can you try PSReadLine 2.0.0-beta1?

comments.author: jianyunt
comments.body: Yes the problem repos on the psreadline 2.0.0-beta1 too.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @jianyunt just to be clear, it also repros without PSReadLine loaded?

comments.author: jianyunt
comments.body: Without PSReadline, I am encountering crash issue https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/6520. But I guess resizing handling is likely in psreadline.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @jianyunt in that case, please open this issue in the [PSReadLine repo](https://github.com/lzybkr/PSReadLine)

title: Cursor position gets miscalculated while rendering output on Linux
